meanings.english_definition: (archaic) Either the dura mater or the sclera.

etymology.value: From Late Latin *sclera*, from Ancient Greek *σκληρός* (sklērós, "hard").

usage_notes.explanation: This is an archaic term, rarely used in modern English. It is most likely encountered in historical medical texts.

readability_explanation.text: This word is highly specialized and rarely used outside of historical or highly technical medical contexts. It is not part of the common English vocabulary.
